intro: Canavalia nualoloensis, commonly known as Nualolo bean, is a flowering plant native to the island of Molokaʻi in Hawaii. It belongs to the legume family Fabaceae and is characterized by its erect growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are typically small and oval in shape. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate and soil conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
